title: Regex Filter Filter
description: Configuration for the Okapi Regex Filter Filter

configurations.name: SRT Sub-Titles
configurations.description: Configuration for SRT (Sub-Rip Text) sub-titles files.
configurations.parametersRaw: #v1 useLd.b=true localizeOutside.b=true startString=" endString=" extractOuterStrings.b=false useBSlashEscape.b=true useDoubleCharEscape.b=false oneLevelGroups.b=false regexOptions.i=40 mimeType=text/plain ruleCount.i=1 rule0.ruleName=Rule rule0.ruleType.i=1 rule0.expr=^(\d+:\d+:\d+.*?)\n(.*?)(\n\n+|\z) rule0.groupSource.i=2 rule0.groupTarget.i=-1 rule0.groupName.i=-1 rule0.groupNote.i=1 rule0.preserveWS.b=true rule0.useCodeFinder.b=true rule0.sample=1$0a$00:00:06,020 --> 00:00:07,020$0a$Hi, everyone.$0a$this is more$0a$$0a$2$0a$00:00:07,020 --> 00:00:08,020$0a$My name is Randy Becker.$0a$$0a$3$0a$00:00:08,020 --> 00:00:11,000$0a$I'm an application engineer at Keysight Technologies. rule0.codeFinderRules.count.i=1 rule0.codeFinderRules.rule0=<\w+.*?>| rule0.codeFinderRules.sample=test bold, test rule0.codeFinderRules.useAllRulesWhenTesting.b=false metaRuleCount.i=2 metaRule0.ruleName=subtitle_start_display metaRule0.expr=\d+:\S+(?=\s+-->) metaRule1.ruleName=subtitle_end_display metaRule1.expr=(?<=-->\s{1,50})\d+:\S+

parameters.rule0.sample: 1$0a$00:00:06,020 --> 00:00:07,020$0a$Hi, everyone.$0a$this is more$0a$$0a$2$0a$00:00:07,020 --> 00:00:08,020$0a$My name is Randy Becker.$0a$$0a$3$0a$00:00:08,020 --> 00:00:11,000$0a$I'm an application engineer at Keysight Technologies.

configurations.name: Text (Line=Paragraph)
configurations.description: Configuration for text files where each line is a text unit
configurations.parametersRaw:
useLD.b=true
localizeOutside.b=true
startString="
endString="
extractOuterStrings.b=false
useBSlashEscape.b=true
oneLevelGroups.b=false
regexOptions.i=8
mimeType=text/plain
ruleCount.i=1
rule0.ruleName=Para
rule0.ruleType.i=1
rule0.expr=(^(?=.+))(.*?)$
rule0.groupSource.i=2
rule0.groupTarget.i=-1
rule0.groupName.i=-1
rule0.groupNote.i=-1
rule0.preserveWS.b=true
rule0.useCodeFinder.b=false
rule0.sample=Text 1$0a$Text 2$0a$$0a$Text 3$0a$Text 4
rule0.codeFinderRules.count.i=0
rule0.codeFinderRules.sample=
rule0.codeFinderRules.useAllRulesWhenTesting.b=false

configurations.name: Text (Block=Paragraph)
configurations.description: Configuration for text files where text units are separated by 2 or more line-breaks.
configurations.parametersRaw:
useLD.b=true
localizeOutside.b=true
startString="
endString="
extractOuterStrings.b=false
useBSlashEscape.b=true
oneLevelGroups.b=false
regexOptions.i=40
mimeType=text/plain
ruleCount.i=1
rule0.ruleName=Para
rule0.ruleType.i=1
rule0.expr=(\n*)(.*?)(\n\n|\Z)
rule0.groupSource.i=2
rule0.groupTarget.i=-1
rule0.groupName.i=-1
rule0.groupNote.i=-1
rule0.preserveWS.b=false
rule0.useCodeFinder.b=false
rule0.sample=$0a$text 1$0a$$0a$$0a$text 2$0a$new line.$0a$$0a$text 3
rule0.codeFinderRules.count.i=0
rule0.codeFinderRules.sample=
rule0.codeFinderRules.useAllRulesWhenTesting.b=false

configurations.name: Text (Mac Strings)
configurations.parametersRaw:
#v1
regexOptions.i=40
startString="
endString="
extractOuterStrings.b=false
useBSlashEscape.b=true
useDoubleCharEscape.b=false
mimeType=text/plain
oneLevelGroups.b=false
useLd.b=true
localizeOutside.b=true
ruleCount.i=6
rule0.ruleName=Comments+String
rule0.ruleType.i=0
rule0.expr=/\*(.*?)\*/\n"(.*?)"\s*=(.*?(?<!\\)(?:\\{2})*");
rule0.groupSource.i=3
rule0.groupTarget.i=-1
rule0.groupName.i=2
rule0.groupNote.i=1
rule0.preserveWS.b=true
rule0.useCodeFinder.b=true
rule0.sample=/* Menu item to make the current document plain text */$0a$"Make Plain Text" = "Make Plain \"Text";$0a$/* Menu item to make the current document rich text */$0a$"Make Rich Text" = "Make Rich Text";$0a$/* An unquoted key */$0a$NSSomeKey = "Foobar";
rule0.codeFinderRules.count.i=3
rule0.codeFinderRules.rule0=%(([-0+#]?)[-0+#]?)((\d\$)?)(([\d\*]*)(\.[\d\*]*)?)[dioxXucsfeEgGpn@]
rule0.codeFinderRules.rule1=(\\r\\n)|\\a|\\b|\\f|\\n|\\r|\\t|\\v
rule0.codeFinderRules.rule2=\<(/?)\w+[^>]*?>
rule0.codeFinderRules.sample=
rule0.codeFinderRules.useAllRulesWhenTesting.b=false
rule1.ruleName=Comments+Unquoted-Key String
rule1.ruleType.i=0
rule1.expr=/\*(.*?)\*/\n([^"\s]+)\s*=(.*?(?<!\\)(?:\\{2})*");
rule1.groupSource.i=3
rule1.groupTarget.i=-1
rule1.groupName.i=2
rule1.groupNote.i=1
rule1.preserveWS.b=true
rule1.useCodeFinder.b=true
rule1.sample=/* An unquoted key */$0a$NSSomeKey = "Foobar";$0a$/* Another unquoted key */$0a$NSSomeKey2 = "Bizbaz";
rule1.codeFinderRules.count.i=3
rule1.codeFinderRules.sample=
rule1.codeFinderRules.useAllRulesWhenTesting.b=false
rule2.ruleName=Bracketing Comments
rule2.ruleType.i=3
rule2.expr=/\*(.*?)\*/
rule2.groupSource.i=1
rule2.groupTarget.i=-1
rule2.groupName.i=-1
rule2.groupNote.i=-1
rule2.preserveWS.b=true
rule2.useCodeFinder.b=false
rule2.sample=test /* test */
rule2.codeFinderRules.count.i=0
rule2.codeFinderRules.sample=
rule2.codeFinderRules.useAllRulesWhenTesting.b=false
rule3.ruleName=Line Comments
rule3.ruleType.i=3
rule3.expr=//(.*?)\n
rule3.groupSource.i=-1
rule3.groupTarget.i=-1
rule3.groupName.i=-1
rule3.groupNote.i=-1
rule3.preserveWS.b=true
rule3.useCodeFinder.b=false
rule3.sample=// test$0a$test // bbb$0a$
rule3.codeFinderRules.count.i=0
rule3.codeFinderRules.rule0=%(([-0+#]?)[-0+#]?)((\d\$)?)(([\d\*]*)(\.[\d\*]*)?)[dioxXucsfeEgGpn@]
rule3.codeFinderRules.rule1=(\\r\\n)|\\a|\\b|\\f|\\n|\\r|\\t|\\v
rule3.codeFinderRules.rule2=\<(/?)\w+[^>]*?>
rule3.codeFinderRules.sample=
rule3.codeFinderRules.useAllRulesWhenTesting.b=false
rule1.codeFinderRules.rule0=%(([-0+#]?)[-0+#]?)((\d\$)?)(([\d\*]*)(\.[\d\*]*)?)[dioxXucsfeEgGpn@]
rule1.codeFinderRules.rule1=(\\r\\n)|\\a|\\b|\\f|\\n|\\r|\\t|\\v
rule1.codeFinderRules.rule2=\<(/?)\w+[^>]*?>
rule4.ruleName=String
rule4.ruleType.i=0
rule4.expr="(.*?)"\s*=(.*?(?<!\\)(?:\\{2})*");
rule4.groupSource.i=2
rule4.groupTarget.i=-1
rule4.groupName.i=1
rule4.groupNote.i=-1
rule4.preserveWS.b=true
rule4.useCodeFinder.b=true
rule4.sample=/* Menu item to make the current document plain text */$0a$"Make Plain Text" = "Make Plain \"Text";$0a$/* Menu item to make the current document rich text */$0a$"Make Rich Text" = "Make Rich Text";$0a$
rule4.codeFinderRules.count.i=3
rule4.codeFinderRules.rule0=%(([-0+#]?)[-0+#]?)((\d\$)?)(([\d\*]*)(\.[\d\*]*)?)[dioxXucsfeEgGpn@]
rule4.codeFinderRules.rule1=(\\r\\n)|\\a|\\b|\\f|\\n|\\r|\\t|\\v
rule4.codeFinderRules.rule2=\<(/?)\w+[^>]*?>
rule4.codeFinderRules.sample=
rule4.codeFinderRules.useAllRulesWhenTesting.b=false
rule5.ruleName=Unquoted-Key String
rule5.ruleType.i=0
rule5.expr=([^\s"]+?)\s*=(.*?(?<!\\)(?:\\{2})*");
rule5.groupSource.i=2
rule5.groupTarget.i=-1
rule5.groupName.i=1
rule5.groupNote.i=-1
rule5.preserveWS.b=true
rule5.useCodeFinder.b=true
rule5.sample=/* An unquoted key */$0a$NSSomeKey = "Foobar";$0a$/* Another unquoted key */$0a$NSSomeKey2 = "Bizbaz";
rule5.codeFinderRules.count.i=3
rule5.codeFinderRules.rule0=%(([-0+#]?)[-0+#]?)((\d\$)?)(([\d\*]*)(\.[\d\*]*)?)[dioxXucsfeEgGpn@]
rule5.codeFinderRules.rule1=(\\r\\n)|\\a|\\b|\\f|\\n|\\r|\\t|\\v
rule5.codeFinderRules.rule2=\<(/?)\w+[^>]*?>
rule5.codeFinderRules.sample=
rule5.codeFinderRules.useAllRulesWhenTesting.b=false

parameters.rule0.sample: /* Menu item to make the current document plain text */$0a$"Make Plain Text" = "Make Plain \"Text";$0a$/* Menu item to make the current document rich text */$0a$"Make Rich Text" = "Make Rich Text";$0a$/* An unquoted key */$0a$NSSomeKey = "Foobar";
parameters.rule1.sample: /* An unquoted key */$0a$NSSomeKey = "Foobar";$0a$/* Another unquoted key */$0a$NSSomeKey2 = "Bizbaz";
parameters.rule4.sample: /* Menu item to make the current document plain text */$0a$"Make Plain Text" = "Make Plain \"Text";$0a$/* Menu item to make the current document rich text */$0a$"Make Rich Text" = "Make Rich Text";$0a$
parameters.rule5.sample: /* An unquoted key */$0a$NSSomeKey = "Foobar";$0a$/* Another unquoted key */$0a$NSSomeKey2 = "Bizbaz";

extractOuterStrings.description: Extract strings outside the main content structure

moveLeadingAndTrailingCodesToSkeleton.description: Move inline codes at segment boundaries to the skeleton (non-translatable)

mergeAdjacentCodes.description: Merge consecutive inline codes into a single placeholder

simplifierRules.description: Rules for simplifying inline code representation

x-groups.label: Extraction Settings
x-groups.description: Control what content is extracted for translation

x-groups.label: Inline Code Handling
x-groups.description: Configure detection and handling of inline codes (placeholders, tags, etc.)
